meanings.definition: To force or drive someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher compelled the students to complete their homework before leaving.
meanings.sent2: She felt compelled to help her friend in need.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat compelled the dog to chase after it by teasing from a safe distance.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody of the music compelled her to dance under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message on the screen compelled everyone to evacuate immediately.

meanings.definition: To feel obligated or pressured to do something
meanings.sent1: The sign on the door compelled him to knock before entering.
meanings.sent2: He was compelled to attend the meeting even though he had other plans.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies compelled him to break his diet for just one bite.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt plea from the charity compelled her to donate all she could spare.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop compelled him to stay and admire it for hours.
